titlestmt.titleproper: William Graham and Graham Gallery papers

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 17:44:15 -0400.

did.unittitle: William Graham and Graham Gallery papers

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The Archives of American art does not own the original papers. Use is limited to the microfilm copy.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Reel 3298: ACCESS RESTRICTED: written permission required.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: REEL 3294: Two scrapbooks containing photographs of works of art, exhibition announcements and catalogs, and clippings about artists affiliated with the gallery.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: REEL 3298: Letters to Graham from Robert Dash, Marilyn Fischbach, and others; and photographs, including pictures of Graham and some of the artists affiliated with the Graham Gallery; and photographs of works of art.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reels 3294 & 3298 available for use only at the Museum of Fine Arts, Houston. Reel 3294 is also available through interlibrary loan.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Originals returned to the lender, William A. Graham, after microfilming.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The Graham Gallery/ William A. Graham Archives located at the Museum of Fine Arts, Houston Archives.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Graham Gallery (est. 1981- closed 1992) was an art gallery in Houston, Texas owned by William A. Graham (1939-1992).

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Lent for microfilming 1984 by William A. Graham, owner and founder of the Graham Gallery.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Microfilmed as part of the Archives of American Art's Texas project.
